programme.title: Ujamaa: A Co-op Culture Story
programme.desc: Explores how government programs in the 1950s and 60s attempted urban renewal but sadly resulted in poverty and health food inequity in the historic African American neighborhood of West Oakland, California. Rather than focusing on the problem, this documentary illustrates how worker-owned cooperatives are an empowering vehicle to build a resilient, healthy community

programme.title: LadyLike
programme.desc: Ladylike is a short film collaboration between Tiffany Johnson and Nicholas Williams, two best friends who met a decade ago in film school. Directed by Tiffany and co-written with Nicholas, Ladylike is a modern day noir that follows Vaughan and Harlan, two vintage vixens who have a penchant for retroâ€¦ and retribution. Not only are they bosom buddies, Vaughan and Harlanâ€™s disturbing pastime makes them a gruesome twosome.

programme.title: CLOSURE
programme.desc: Angela, an African-American raised by a Caucasian couple in a large, multiracial family in Washington State, comes face to face with her birth mother for the first time, and meets family members who had never known she was even born â€“ including her birth father.

programme.title: BLACK GIRL IN PARIS
programme.desc: When a down on her luck aspiring writer runs out of money after moving to Paris, she meets a street-smart prostitute who takes her on a whirlwind adventure of passion, self-discovery and uninhibited sexual freedom.

programme.title: NURSE.FIGHTER.BOY.
programme.desc: While working as a night-shift nurse to support her son, Jude, a widowed single mother undergoing treatment for sickle cell disease meets and enters into a relationship with Silence, a troubled and brooding boxer who becomes a father figure for the young boy.

programme.title: Malcolm X: AN OVERWHELMING INFLUENCE ON THE BLACK POWER MOVEMENT
programme.desc: This documentary will give viewers new insight into how Malcolm X changed America through revolutionary ideas, actions, and strategies: ideas that are still relevant and playing out in today's world. Concurrently, viewers get to know Malcolm X, the man, through personal accounts with friends, co-workers and family members along with engaging photos and footage.

programme.title: AFROKONS
programme.desc: Sila Apiseh, a young woman, decides to run for office. She engages in a battle to empower women and give hope to youth in her country, AFROKONS.

programme.title: A LOVER'S CALL
programme.desc: Assim is torn between his faith and a growing bond with poet Kala when he realizes she isn't Muslim.

programme.title: LadyLike
programme.desc: Ladylike is a short film collaboration between Tiffany Johnson and Nicholas Williams, two best friends who met a decade ago in film school. Directed by Tiffany and co-written with Nicholas, Ladylike is a modern day noir that follows Vaughan and Harlan, two vintage vixens who have a penchant for retroâ€¦ and retribution. Not only are they bosom buddies, Vaughan and Harlanâ€™s disturbing pastime makes them a gruesome twosome.

programme.title: While I Breathe I Hope
programme.desc: Through the experiences of South Carolina Politician Bakari Sellers, WHILE I BREATHE, I HOPE explores what it means to be young, Black, and Democrat in the American South. Executive Produced by Charlamagne Tha God.

programme.title: Pahokee - The Send Off
programme.desc: Three award-winning short films that exquisitely capture the Pahokee community, a small black Florida town.

programme.title: The Third Space EP1
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: The Third Space EP2
programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.desc: The coffee shop is the perfect setting to have rich and in depth conversations with some of the most influential change-makers in the Bay Area and beyond. TTS has an entirely Black and people of color crew in front of and behind the camera.

programme.title: CLOSE TO THE LINE
programme.desc: The true story of a spiritual journey. Singer/songwriter Chris Van Loan Sr.'s life is changed forever because of the events that occur in one evening amongst some of Austin's most eclectic musicians and poets. Featuring cameo appearances by Kevin Gant and Thom the World Poet.

programme.title: LITTLE MUSIC MANCHILD: THE STORY OF MALIK KOFI
programme.desc: The story follows an 11-year old African American Birmingham native, child prodigy who plays the cello.

programme.title: LA SOLEDAD
programme.desc: Capturing the life of real people amidst the Venezuelan crisis, La Soledad is the story of JosĂ©, a young father who discovers that the dilapidated mansion he occupies will soon be demolished. Desperate to save his family from homelessness, JosĂ© begins a search for a cursed treasure that has long said to be buried in the hous

programme.title: MeMaw
programme.desc: MeMaw is the story of a young woman, Jessie, who finds out she is pregnant the same week her grandmother is diagnosed with a terminal illness. She decides to document the progression of her pregnancy during her grandmotherâ€™s final days to share those special moments with her future daughter.

programme.title: The Invisible Vegan
programme.desc: The Invisible Vegan explores the problem of unhealthy dietary patterns in the African-American community, foregrounding the health and wellness possibilities enabled by plant-based vegan diets and lifestyle choices. The documentary begins with the personal story of Jasmine Leyva, a 30-year-old black actress and filmmaker

programme.title: Gonzo Episode 1
programme.desc: A drama that follows the struggles of black college students and their efforts to make reform on their university campus. But once there is a clash in ideology between the schoolâ€™s Black Student Organization and Gonzo, Gonzo is pressured to step up, take charge, and be the voice of the schoolâ€™s black student body.

programme.title: FIRST DATE
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.
